action.action-desc: Mr. Lewis of Georgia (for himself, Ms. DelBene, Mr. Blumenauer, and Mr. Danny K. Davis of Illinois) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to reduce taxpayer burdens and enhance taxpayer protections, and for other purposes.

subsection.text: This Act may be cited as the Taxpayer Protection Act of 2017.

Except as otherwise expressly provided, whenever in this Act an amendment or repeal is expressed in terms of an amendment to, or repeal of, a section or other provision, the reference shall be considered to be made to a section or other provision of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

title.header: Protection of Taxpayers from Abusive Tax Collection Practices

section.header: Repeal of rules relating to tax collection contracts

subsection.text: Sections 6306 and 6307 are hereby repealed, and the table of sections for subchapter A of chapter 64 is amended by striking the items relating to sections 6306 and 6307.

paragraph.text: Section 6103(k) is amended by striking paragraph (12).
Section 7433A(a) is amended by inserting , as in effect on the day before the date of the enactment of the Taxpayer Protection Act of 2017 after as defined in section 6306(b).
Section 7809(a) is amended by striking 6306,.
Section 7811 is amended by striking subsection (g).

section.header: De minimis exclusion from gross income for discharge of indebtedness of individuals

subsection.text: Section 108(a)(1) is amended by striking or at the end of subparagraph (D), by striking the period at the end of subparagraph (E) and inserting , or, and by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: the indebtedness discharged is qualified individual indebtedness.

subsection.text: Section 108 is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Special rules relating to qualified individual indebtedness

paragraph.text: For purposes of this section, the term qualified individual indebtedness means any indebtedness of an individual other than indebtedness which is—

subparagraph.text: discharged on account of services performed for the lender, or
held at any time by a person related to such individual.

paragraph.continuation-text: For purposes of subparagraph (B), a person shall be treated as related to another person if the relationship between such persons would result in a disallowance of losses under section 267 or 707(b).

paragraph.text: The amount of qualified individual indebtedness excluded from gross income under subsection (a)(1)(F) with respect to any individual for any taxable year shall not exceed the excess of—

subparagraph.text: the aggregate amount excluded from the gross income of such individual under subsection (a)(1) for such taxable year and all prior taxable years (determined without regard to any amount excludable from gross income under subsection (a)(1)(F) for such taxable year).

paragraph.text: In the case of a joint return—

subparagraph.text: the dollar limitation under paragraph (2) shall be applied separately to each spouse, and
the taxpayer may elect to treat any indebtedness of either spouse as indebtedness of the other spouse.

paragraph.text: Section 108(a)(2) is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

clause.header: Individual indebtedness exclusion takes precedence over insolvency exclusion unless elected otherwise
clause.text: Paragraph (1)(B) shall not apply to a discharge to which paragraph (1)(F) applies unless the taxpayer elects to apply paragraph (1)(B) in lieu of paragraph (1)(F).
Subparagraph (F) shall not apply to a discharge to which subparagraph (C), (D), or (E) applies.

paragraph.text: Section 108(a)(2)(A) is amended by striking and (E) and inserting (E), and (F).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to discharges of indebtedness after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Repeal suspension of statute of limitations during pending application for Taxpayer Assistance order

subsection.text: Section 7811 is amended by striking subsection (d) and redesignating subsections (e), (f), and (g) as subsections (d), (e), and (f), respectively.
Section 6306(k)(2) is amended by striking section 7811(g) and inserting section 7811(f).
The amendment made by this section shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Limitation on levy on retirement savings

subsection.text: Section 6334(a) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: Any individual’s interest in a qualified retirement plan—

clause.text: before such individual has attained normal retirement age (or 65 in the case of an individual retirement account or a plan which does not specify a normal retirement age), or
after the attainment of such age if the levy would create an economic hardship due to the financial condition of the taxpayer (within the meaning of 6343(a)(1)(D)).

subparagraph.text: For purposes of this paragraph, the term qualified retirement plan means—

subclause.text: is described in section 401(a) and which includes a trust exempt from tax under section 501(a),
is described in subsection (a) or (b) of section 403, or
is an eligible deferred compensation plan (as defined in section 457(b)) of an eligible employer described in section 457(e)(1)(A).

subparagraph.text: Subparagraph (A) shall not apply if the Secretary determines that—

clause.text: the taxpayer filed a fraudulent return, or
the taxpayer acted with the intent to evade or defeat any tax imposed by this title or the collection or payment thereof.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to levies issued after December 31, 2017.

section.header: Tolling of limitation on levy recovery for disabled taxpayer

subsection.text: Section 6343(b) is amended by inserting after the third sentence: In the case of an individual, the running of such 9-month period shall be suspended during any period of such individual’s life that such individual is financially disabled (as defined in section 6511(h))..

subsection.header: Suits by persons other than taxpayers
subsection.text: Section 6532(c)(1) is amended by adding at the end the following: In the case of an individual, the running of such 9-month period shall be suspended during any period of such individual’s life that such individual is financially disabled (as defined in section 6511(h))..

section.header: Extension of period to withdraw frivolous submission

subsection.text: Section 6702(b)(3) is amended by striking 30 days and inserting 60 days.
The amendment made by this section shall apply to notices provided after December 31, 2017.

section.header: Repeal of partial payment requirement on submissions of offers-in-compromise

subsection.text: Section 7122 is amended by striking subsection (c) and by redesignating subsections (d), (e), (f), and (g) as subsections (c), (d), (e), and (f), respectively.

paragraph.text: Section 7122(d)(3) is amended by inserting and at the end of the subparagraph (A), by striking , and at the end of subparagraph (B) and inserting a period, and by striking subparagraph (C).
Section 7122, as amended by this section, is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: In the case of any assessed tax or other amounts imposed under this title with respect to such tax which is the subject of an offer-in-compromise, such tax or other amounts shall be reduced by any user fee imposed under this title with respect to such offer-in-compromise.

paragraph.text: Section 6159(f) is amended by striking section 7122(e) and inserting section 7122(d).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to offers submitted after the date of the enactment of this Act.

title.header: Assistance for Identity Theft Victims and Low-Income Taxpayers

section.header: Taxpayer notification of suspected identity theft

subsection.text: Chapter 77 is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.text: If the Secretary determines that there was an unauthorized use of the identity of any taxpayer, the Secretary shall—

paragraph.text: as soon as practicable and without jeopardizing an investigation relating to tax administration, notify the taxpayer, and
if any person is criminally charged by indictment or information relating to such unauthorized use, notify such taxpayer as soon as practicable of such charge.

subsection.text: The table of sections for chapter 77 is amended by adding at the end the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 7529. Notification of suspected identity theft.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to determinations made after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Single point of contact for identity theft victims

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Treasury, or the Secretary’s delegate, shall establish new procedures to ensure that any taxpayer whose return has been delayed or otherwise adversely affected due to identity theft has a single point of contact at the Internal Revenue Service throughout the processing of his or her case. The single point of contact shall track the case of the taxpayer from start to finish and coordinate with other specialized units to resolve case issues as quickly as possible.

subsection.header: Full-Time IRS employee for single point of contact in certain cases
subsection.text: If any identity theft case involves multiple units of the Internal Revenue Service or multiple tax years, the single point of contact required by subsection (a) shall be one full-time employee of the Internal Revenue Service.

section.header: Referrals to low-income taxpayer clinics permitted

subsection.text: Section 7526(c) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Treasury employees permitted to refer taxpayers to qualified low-income taxpayer clinics
paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, officers and employees of the Department of the Treasury may refer taxpayers for advice and assistance to qualified low-income taxpayer clinics receiving funding under this section.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to referrals made after the date of the enactment of this Act.
Section 32 is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Notification of potential eligibility for credit and refund

paragraph.text: To the extent possible and on an annual basis, the Secretary shall provide notice to each taxpayer who—

subparagraph.text: did not claim the credit under subsection (a) for any preceding taxable year for which credit or refund is not precluded by section 6511, and
may be allowed such credit for any such taxable year based on return or return information (as defined in section 6103(b)) available to the Secretary,

paragraph.continuation-text: that such taxpayer may be eligible to claim such credit and a refund for such taxable year.

paragraph.text: Notice provided under paragraph (1) shall be in writing and sent to the last known address of the taxpayer.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall take effect on January 1, 2018.

title.header: Ensure Taxpayer Access to Competent Tax Return Preparers

subsection.text: Section 330(a) of title 31, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking paragraph (1) and inserting the following:
regulate—

subparagraph.text: the practice of representatives of persons before the Department of the Treasury; and
the practice of tax return preparers; and

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2)—

subparagraph.text: by inserting or tax return preparer after representative each place it appears, and
by inserting or in preparing their tax returns, claims for refund, or documents in connection with tax returns or claims for refund after cases in subparagraph (D).

subsection.header: Authority To sanction regulated tax return preparers
subsection.text: Section 330(c) of title 31, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting or tax return preparer after representative each place it appears, and
in paragraph (4), by striking misleads or threatens and all that follows and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: any person being represented or any prospective person being represented; or
any person or prospective person whose tax return, claim for refund, or document in connection with a tax return or claim for refund, is being or may be prepared.

subsection.text: Section 330 of title 31, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:
For purposes of this section—

paragraph.text: The term tax return preparer has the meaning given such term under section 7701(a)(36) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
The term tax return has the meaning given to the term return under section 6696(e)(1) of such Code.
The term claim for refund has the meaning given such term under section 6696(e)(2) of such Code.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to returns and claims for refund for taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Tax information disclosure relating to tax return preparer misconduct
section.text: Section 6103(k), as amended by section 101, is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Disclosure relating to tax return preparer misconduct
paragraph.text: Under such procedures as the Secretary may prescribe, the Secretary may disclose returns or return information to the extent necessary to publish final decisions by the Internal Revenue Service Office of Professional Responsibility relating to tax return preparer misconduct.

title.header: Increase Funding for Services to Taxpayers

subsection.text: Section 7526(c)(1) is amended by striking $6,000,000 and inserting $20,000,000.
Section 7526(c)(5) is amended by inserting qualified before low-income.
The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to grants made after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Internal Revenue Service taxpayer services appropriations
section.text: There is hereby appropriated, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2018, for necessary expenses of the Internal Revenue Service to provide taxpayer services, including pre-filing assistance and education, filing and account services, taxpayer advocacy services, and other services as authorized by 5 U.S.C. 3109, at such rates as may be determined by the Commissioner, $2,406,000,000.
